intro: Psychotria elata, commonly known as the "Blue Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue flowers, which are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria elata is also notable for its use in traditional medicine and its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators.
